Can easily get high marks in the quiz in canvas with lecture notes and google. Concert Report and Case study can get pretty good marks if you are not hea do it. The most important is the midterm and final have to recite the content, otherwise you cannot get good marks.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quiz after every topic(eg. music from the country). Can easily get high marks in the quiz in canvas with lecture notes and google.
Concert Report and Case study need more time to be done. Just try to use the knowledge you learn from the lecture and use more example and comparison, and you can get quite good marks.

reviews.author: Bianca
reviews.comment_content: 好多嘢讀，讀除左歐洲古典音樂意外嘅其他音樂例如中國、印度、拉丁美洲嘅音樂等等。好多阿拉伯文非洲文樂器要記，上堂PPT成版都喺字，睇得好辛苦。
reviews.comment_teaching: 個Pro try to make it fun. 上堂take attendance, 有時靜喺會對住ppt講，midterm 同 final會比份guideline，上面有成百幾二百個term，話如果你知曬喺咩來就會靠高分。
reviews.comment_grading: absolute grading.兩三分一個sub grade. 85% Above 1 sd got a B.
reviews.comment_workload: 勁多嘢做，有online quiz 有case study 有concert review有midterm 有final.

reviews.author: lilykam
reviews.comment_content: 從非洲到中國的音樂都有教,唯獨是樂理部分太淺了,學不到應用的知識。
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite interesting. Prof會唱歌給大家醒醒腦
reviews.comment_grading: 很多人會拿高分, 就算學過音樂的人也未必能進來刷grade
reviews.comment_workload: Assignment不算多, QUIZ也普遍能拿高分,只是很多專業名詞要背(非洲文什麼的)

reviews.author: non ono
reviews.comment_content: Cover a lot of content and pretty detailed. All MC in Midterm and MC + fill in the blanks in final, around 100 questions. Discuss so much more than only music itself but also involves a lot of cultural material. Always good to have some music background but doesn't help much in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Great. Interesting teaching. Do a lot of listening and some singing in class.
reviews.comment_grading: Quiz+Midterm+Final+Case study+Concert Review+Attendance.
reviews.comment_workload: Super heavy workload for a 1- course. You need to memorise everything in the lecture notes and also familiar with the listening soundtrack. The case study is the worst, takes up all your time.

reviews.author: CHEN WEILI
reviews.title: Music of the world
reviews.comment_content: i thought it was about some beautiful pieces like Mozart or something but what a pity, i...was...wrong. Anyway it had nothing to do with those classical pieces, but all about musical cultures around the world, which was African, North American, Indian music... I have to say that the pieces were not so pleasant, sometimes annoying, and the exams focused  mostly on its history and cultural backgrounds, anyway it's a HUMA class...
reviews.comment_teaching: the professor was quite humorous, not bad i think, although there're always some little spelling mistakes in the lecture notes hhh. his english was excellent but the vocabulary was quite professional.
reviews.comment_grading: my grade was B, which was not good I think. A range was not large, about 14%? My mid-term was totally mess, so make sure you do remember all the items in ppt, not just in the reviewing list he gives you.
reviews.comment_workload: there's a mid-term, a final, a case study which you need an essay of 1500-1800 words, and a concert report of about 600 words, as well as two simpler quizzes.

reviews.author: C666
reviews.title: suitable for ppl who love music
reviews.comment_content: For people who don't like music, it would be super boring. But for me, I think it is acceptable. Basically you just have to rmb all the notes and songs are ok. Easy level.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a good teacher in lesson he always wants to make our class interesting but it is still boring in fact. All the locals are very quiet in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Standard grading, very bad.
He said he would not give out any A+.
For me , total 88.8% > only B+
my case study : 92/100 (mean 87)
concert report: 90/ 100  (mean 89)
midterm : 79/ 100 (mean 71)
final: 85/100 (mean 70)
Case study and concert report don't matter,
so work hard on the midterm and finals.
For participation, you can skip 3 lessons.
reviews.comment_workload:
Heavy workload. A lot of songs to recite in exams.
I spent many nights on my case study (over 3000 words tgt with evidence, log, pictures and videos) but the mark is still low.  
There are also 2 quiz but you have one day to finish and almost everybody got full marks.

reviews.author: pjj
reviews.title: Huma Music
reviews.comment_content: it is comprehensive and suitable for anyone who wants to have shallow but wide knowledge of music. The professor also requires us to buy a book but it is not necessary for preparing for exams. You can look at the powerpoints to pass the exams. Overall its pretty good in terms of content.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is a bit boring because the lecture hall is big and easy to lose focus when people on the back are talking. Some people leave the lecture hall after they take the PRS so it is tempting to go out during middle of the class.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is pretty bad. I got A's in two reports and participation, B's in one midterm and final. Overall I got a B
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. You just have to take close look at the powerpoints before exams.

reviews.author: Sylvester
reviews.title: Average course
reviews.comment_content: Dont have a lot to add on the contents of the course, most of them have pretty much been mentioned by previous reviews. But remember you do not necessarily need to have a strong music background (or even a single knowkledge on music) in order to survive or get good grades in this course. You can treat this as a history course instead of a music course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor teaches well, even with occasional jokes. He is patient to students' questions, no matter in-class or through emails.
reviews.comment_grading: The professor has indicated clearly that he rarely gives out A+ and he gives A- or A to the top 1x% students. I personally got about 91% of the overall course mark and ended up getting an A-. In overall, this is in fact not a course with particularly good grades.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not that heavy in fact. The professor will assign 3x pages of readings after every lesson but usually the exams wont cover those contents so no worries.

reviews.author: VL
reviews.title: POOR Course
reviews.comment_content: Study about African Music, South American Music, Latin American Music, Arabic World Music, Indian Music and Chinese Music. Contains a lot of new words to memorize, and need spend much time for studying.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite boring, though there are a lot of listening in class, and professor tried to cheer us up, but the overall atmosphere was not good.
reviews.comment_grading: Poor, very narrow grading range, my friend got a B for overall 81%, I got a C for 77%. Need to do well in mid term and finals. Concert report and case study proposal don't matter.
reviews.comment_workload:
1%Case study proposal
19%Case study
10%Pre quiz 1+2
10%Concert Report
10%Attendance
20%Mid term
30%Final

reviews.author: gossipgirl
reviews.comment_content:
The content is pretty nice. Discusses 6 cultures.
Africa, North America, Latin America, Arab World, India and China. Introduces music music terminology and relates them to these cultures.
Exams are pretty much based on the notes.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a really good professor. Gives nice examples and explains well. Attendance will definitely make your work easier.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is nice if you satisfy all the course requirements well. Its slightly different from other courses. A mix of absolute and relative grading.

Need a 97% + to get A+.
Not hard to get, but narrow margins can change your grade very easily
reviews.comment_workload:
The main issue with the course is workload. Although the course is interesting and fun, doesn't mean we don't have any other courses.
Attendance - 10%
Case Study - 20%
Concert Report - 10%
Midterm - 20%
Final - 30%
2 Quizzes - 10%

Its not very difficult to do everything, but can be a bit tiring.

reviews.author: John Ma
reviews.title: Meaningless Race to Who Can Memorize the Most African/Arabic Words
reviews.comment_content: The title says it all. As a common core HUMA course, the name 'Music of the World' can trick you to think it is a rather easy course. NO. See the workload and teaching.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lectures are boring as hell because Isaac has a bad sense of humour although he tries his best to engage the students by asking us to stand and do stretches in the middle of the class.

[Worst lecture notes]
Not concise. Very messy. Expects us to find the definitions of word lists on our own. (he gives a word list every midterm/final and says those words will be examed, however no definitions are give and we have to find them ourselves)

He also tries to invite a guest speaker to talk about Chinese music but the speaker was also very boring and we were just given clips of the speaker playing the Sanxian.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is rather fine because as long as you can write reasonable reports and reason well. Although the Canvas quizzes are pretty stupid, it took us hell a lot of time to get full marks.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very heavy. This is just a 3-credit course and the workload can match a 5-cred course.

Midterm+Final (MCQ plus map questions plus fill-in-the-blanks)

2 Reports (Case Study + Concert Report): both have to be around 1000 words.

2 Quizzes (stupid Canvas quizzes)

PRS (every lesson, 3-4 buffers before you get mark deduction)

reviews.author: Kaz Stephen
reviews.title: Short Review
reviews.comment_content: 讀一D世界各地(eg.非洲, 美洲, 歐洲)既音樂同歷史 上堂會聽下唔同音樂同睇片 一D平時大家見到既樂器就會少見D
reviews.comment_teaching: 個Instructor係好有心機教既 佢既英文都叫易聽 上堂都幾輕鬆既 不時會有一D互動 Send Email問佢都會好快就覆 真係對音樂有興趣既同學應該會同佢好好傾
reviews.comment_grading: 都幾好Grade 全班冇乜人Fail/D 最多既係B range 可能一班多人上掛
reviews.comment_workload: 基本上要背晒佢既Notes同記熟唔同音樂category既melody 有冇音樂底其實唔係真係太關事 最多係一開始jargon會令有音樂底既人有advantage

reviews.author: N
reviews.title: 有音樂底子的人會更好GRADE
reviews.comment_content: 學到世界各地音樂文化, 歷史, 樂器等等, 絕對唔止平時接觸到既西樂/中樂, 但都幾多notes
reviews.comment_teaching: 上堂有些少悶, 但有好多音樂聽, 有互動遊戲, Professor其實好有HEART教書,但可能D學生聽唔明比唔到反應, 希望學過音樂/有底子既人會上下佢堂, 其實唔差
reviews.comment_grading:
唔拉CURVE, Absolute grading
因為MC其實算易, 如果
1) 背得夠熟
2) 有音樂底子 (optional)
3) 上堂有聽書/就算唔聽都有睇返VIDEO
Take attendance有用
reviews.comment_workload:
有LMES QUIZ但係屋企做,當溫書,送分
1 midterm, 1 final exam
有2份Assignment, 一份長文,自訂題目, 一份係聽音樂會既feedback, 其實有好多時間prepare, 對音樂其他方面有興趣既人應該會更易上手, 中意research寫文既人都無難度

reviews.author: gwamba101
reviews.comment_content:
COURSE OUTLINE:

This course is a survey of selected world music outside the Western European tradition. Students will learn to understand world music through aspects of culture and society.

INTENDED LEARNING OUTCOMES:

On completion of the course, students should:

have developed an interest towards world music
be able to comprehend basic ethnomusicological terms and concepts and the background information of each studied culture
be able to identify aurally the characteristics of the world music studied and discussed
be able to demonstrate an understanding of the relationship between music and culture
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching style was appreciated. While the content sometimes got quite boring or text/fact heavy, he tried to mix it up by including examples when necessary. For example, he would show music videos or audio clips and even once created a song to help make the class more interactive.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance of Lectures 10%

5 graded online reviews 10% (Mostly M.C.)

Midterm 20% (Mostly M.C.)
Final Exam 30%

Understanding of the relationship between music and culture and the creation of music.

Discussion posts 10%

Case Study 20%
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not super light, but also not the worst. There is usually one timed quiz every week or every two weeks, but they are quite easily and open book/note. The information can be found on his powerpoints, which he posts on the canvas. There is also a final project which takes quite long to plan, film, and edit, but still can be done in a few days if you procrastinate.

reviews.author: hi_hello
reviews.comment_content: This course is literally about the music of the world. Students learn about the music and the culture behind places like Africa, India, and China. If you have interest in learning about history, culture and any other information related to memorizing instrument names, you should take the course. Otherwise, I advise you not to take it. The professor gives us reading assignments, but I did not do them.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is nice. He usually sings in class. He also often plays the piano. He also brings strange instruments in class for us to observe.
reviews.comment_grading: It is absolute grading. Attendance, case study, concert review, mid term, final and quizzes are all part of the grade.
reviews.comment_workload: You have to write 5000 word essay about a music culture of your choice. A lot of things to do. I do not recommend people to take the course.

reviews.author: sableye
reviews.title: Worst course I have taken in 4 years of my study
reviews.comment_content: Like what the other reviews have mentioned, this course is basically all about reciting. You are required to know many languages/cultures like Indian, Middle East, Chinese, Black, South American etc. There is nothing useful about this course, and I would not remember a single thing from this course a two days after the exam, except that I would probably remember this is the worst course of my life.
reviews.comment_teaching: At least the professor is nice. But he doesn't even proofread his materials, which have a lot of low-level grammatical errors. Even a student with bad English like me could spot like 5 errors every powerpoint, which makes me think that the professor doesn't really care about language when he has to grade people based on "grammar and spellings". Jokes.
reviews.comment_grading: Semi absolute grading. Very unfair deadlines. Yeah true the professor is nice and he always extends the deadlines and stuff, but I worked my ass off to meet the deadline, and after the deadline he told everyone that the deadline is extended so everyone can be able to have a longer time for the quiz/assignment. thank you so much for wasting my precious time.
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely heavy workload, as mentioned by other . Heavier than my major courses at 4000-level.

Case study, concert report, attendance every lesson, quiz every other week. All pointless.

reviews.author: timothio
reviews.title: Register if you are a reciting machine
reviews.comment_content: the content is all about different cultures and their music.  It is certainly fun to learn about the interments in Africa and how people in Arab make music. If you are interested in music, you will definitely find this course entertaining, BUT entertaining doesn't mean you are having a great time studying it.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching style is straight up reading powerpoints.  Nice guy, easily get annoyed by crowd chatting.  Nothing special, just common uni professors.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is pretty poor. As people are very good at reciting content in the powerpoint slides, you can expect the mean to be very high.  Making careless mistakes in MC questions will definitely give you a bad grade.  

One thing to mention, the final exam requires you to remember the name of the instruments in other languages and fill in the blanks.  No idea how it helps to learn music.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty heavy to be honest.  Reciting large amount of content and remember the names and instruments in a foreign language is pretty tedious and time consuming.

reviews.author: Johnny Deep
reviews.title: HUMA1100
reviews.comment_content: Same as the course code. You will basically learn some basic concepts about every music style in the world.
reviews.comment_teaching: He teaches well. Plenty of music examples are given. For those who are not interested in music may find the lecture boring but to be frank, I think he is doing a good job that you will appreciate.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you spend enough time to study the notes good enough, you should have done well in the exam.
The more you pay, the more you gain, I would say.
reviews.comment_workload: Reasonable. You can simply study the notes just before exam and spend a day or two doing those reports. Again, The more you pay, the more you gain.

reviews.author: luke_lu
reviews.title: Travel with music
reviews.comment_content:
Music of:
Africa, Black America(pre- and post-slavery), Arab, Latin, India, China

This course will introduce each musical culture with examples, relevant history, instruments. (you will need to memorize all of them!)

you will learn a lot about non-mainstream music. Interesting class if you like music in general. Also good CC
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof is a funny person. He goes through slides and example videos in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
QUIZZES 10% (20 MC, timed, open book)
Discussions 10% (just write whatever)
ATTENDANCE 10% (random)
CASE STUDY PROPOSAL 1%
CASE STUDY 19% (12min video)
MIDTERM EXAM 20% (MC +fill in the blank + listening)
FINAL EXAM 30%  (MC +fill in the blank + listening +Essay)

Absolute grading
90%+ A range
80%+ B range
etc,
Pretty easy to get A
reviews.comment_workload:
Luckily online open book exams and quizzes this term. There are many terms to memorize.
For more about the final exam see the attachment

Most of the in-term workload is from the Case study. You will need to do a 12 min video about any (non-western) musical culture. Could be any culture no matter big or small. (I did Vocaloid culture lol)
You can(should) start working on it early.
